1.brief: to pull off; hence (intensively) to strip, (reflex.) to depart; by implication, to deliver, equip (for fight); present, strengthen
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)

2.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)

3.brief: to point (transitive or intransitive); intensively, to pierce; figuratively, to inculcate
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)

4.brief: properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
a stroke, literally or figuratively (in various applications, as follow)

5.brief: a (metallic) sheet (as pounded thin); also a spring net (as spread out like a lamina)

a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
a track (literally or figuratively); also a rampart (as circular)
a noose (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a hook (for the nose)
to place (in a very wide application)

6.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

7.brief: the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
properly, to entwine as ascreen; by implication, to fence in, cover over, (figuratively) protect
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
military equipment, i.e. (collectively) arms (offensive or defensive), or (concretely) an arsenal

8.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to issue, i.e. furnish; causatively, to secure; figuratively, to succeed
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)

9.brief: the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
a divan (as enclosing the room); abstractly (adverbial) around
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)

10.brief: to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)

11.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to lie alongside (i.e. in wait); by implication, to catch an animal (figuratively, men); to victual (for a journey)

12.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
judgement (the suit, justice, sentence or tribunal); by implication also strife

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

13.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

14.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
